text: The fist is in a boxing glove. It belongs to VIC DEAKINS, The face belongs to RAWLEY HALE, 28. They are in...
Hale and Deakins are sparring in a ring. Other people are lifting weights, shooting baskets.
Hale and Deakins circle each other. Hale is shaking cobwe of his head.
You know what happened there?
Hell, I barely know what day it is.

I set you up. I fake right, go left three times in a row. You expect it again, I take the right in hard. That's what boxing's all about. Make your opponent think you're gonna do one thing, then do another. Like Ali in Zaire, using the rope-a-dope on Foreman. (mimes rope-a-dope) Everyone thought Ali's arms were getting destroyed, when he was really just letting Foreman tire himself out. Eighth round, Ali starts hitting, George's got nothing left -- fight's over.
The fact that I can't feel the left side of my face -- that's okay, right? Deakins laughs. Hale seizes the relaxed moment and sudden launches into Deakins with a flurry of punches.

head_text.subj: THE OTHER PEOPLE IN THE GYM

text: Take notice -- the fight is getting real. They move to th
Several of Hale's punches land. Deakins staggers back, ca off guard. It looks like he might even go down. 2.
He cocks his arm back. He could finish Deakins off. But h doesn't. He drops his fist.
Seizes the opportunity and slugs back.
Loves it.
Now Deakins has the upperhand. He backs Hale around the r
Don't watch my hands -- watch my shoulders. That's where the punch starts. Ready? Deakins hits Hale hard in the face, sending him back.
Are circling the ring, following the fighters, cheering.
You were looking at my hands. Let's try it again. Ready? Deakins hits Hale hard. He's got Hale on the run.
Come on. Focus. Ready? (PUNCH)
My shoulders. Ready? Deakins fakes left, puts everything into one big uppercut connects.
Lands, dazed, blood trickling out of the corner of his mo
He's in silhouette, the lights above him.
Looks up at Deakins, catches his breath. 3.

Deakins offers his hand. Hale pushes it aside. Deakins ig Hale, grabs him and helps him to his feet. Deakins climbs of the ring between the ropes. Hale grabs the top rope and flips himself over, landing o feet. Deakins gives Hale a look, laughs, shakes his head.
Hale lets the water rinse the blood off his face.

Hale and Deakins are sitting on the bench between their l getting into their flightsuits, pulling on boots. Deakins smoking a cigarette. The smoke curls up into the light sl down across the room from high windows.
Is in sunlight. On the inside of his locker door are pict of exotic planes -- the SR-71, a swept-wing fighter, an a rendition of the Aurora, etc.
On the shady side of the room. Nothing on the inside of h locker door. The locker is spare, Zen-like in its neatnes
Here.
Slams a twenty dollar bill down on the bench.
I can't take that.
Oh, shut up.
Really. I feel bad. How many times have we fought and how many times have you won?
Jerk.
Well, if you insist. Deakins grins, folds the bill and jams it into his flight 4.
You know why I beat you?
Because you've been boxing for twenty years and you're much better at it than I am?
You don't want it enough. You had me today. I was back on my heels. But you didn't close the door.
We were just sparring.
Life isn't sparring, Hale.
I think I saw that on a T-shirt. Deakins pulls out the twenty dollar bill; hands it back t
Here.
No, that's yours.
If you weren't giving it everything you've got, then I don't want it.
No, I mean -- that's yours, literally. I took it out of your wallet when you were in the shower. Deakins laughs, puts the money away.
Planes taxiing, vehicles moving.
Deakins and Hale enter to find GENERAL BOONE, 50s.
General. 5.
Gentlemen. (nods at NO SMOKING
Deak?
Sorry. (puts out cigarette) What's the mission, General?
Simulate a border penetration. Hug the ground. Scare some cows. See if anyone can spot you.
The usual ...?

No, actually, it's a little unusual. You're carrying a couple of nukes tonight, fellas. (off their looks) Palmdale's afraid low-level gamma and x-ray diffusion might screw up the peripherals. They asked us to send a couple on a run, see if anything glows.
(shakes head) Big ones. '83s.
Ooh. Crowpleasers.
A BOMB TRUCK carrying two B-83 nuclear weapons drives und wing of a big, black plane, toward the open bomb bays. GR CREWMEN are hurrying about.
Enter and walk under the plane, nodding to the ground cre and Deakins are royalty. Deakins and Hale climb up the airplane's Crew Entry steps and disappear.

Hale and Deakins climb into a very strange cockpit. There two pilots' seats in this plane, with duplicate controls. 6. But instead of the usual dials and gauges on the control there are FOUR COMPUTER SCREENS in front of each pilot. H gets into the left seat; Deakins the right. They review information on their screens, flip switches.
Being loaded into the bomb bays. When they've been clampe place in the rotary bomb racks...
(into helmet mike) Ready for rollout.
Alarm horns sound, wheels roll on track and the huge hang doors open revealing...
An enormous black flying wing.
Deakins looks at maps on his computer screens. Hale looks sees the map of Utah.
You know, these exercises are fantastic. I mean, when that day comes and we finally go to war against Utah, we are really going to kick ass.
Bright moonlight shows a campfire burning at the edge of escarpment, the Colorado River a thousand feet below. Nea campfire is an Army surplus tent. Next to it, an easel ho painting in progress.
Drives up, stops. The driver's door open, and out gets...
We don't see his face in the dark. He switches on a flash walks over and taps on the tent.
Park Ranger. I'd like to talk to somebody about this fire. 7. We hear a man and a woman -- JIM and WANDA, 60s -- wake u
Wha--? Oh, hell.
I'll talk to him, Jim.
Wanda, you stay put. Jim comes out of the tent, the ranger's light in his face
I know -- no wood fires in the Park. It's just -- Wanda's got a cold and I wanted her to stay warm.
Sir, you see any other hikers, campers anywhere around here?
Not this time of year. What's the fine for something like this?

Your life. Jim grins. But the ranger pulls out a pistol and shoots J who falls into the fire. He then puts three shots through wall of the tent. Nothing moves. The Ranger -- call him BAKER -- pulls out a walkie-talkie, clicks on.
Done.

Come on and two Humvees roll in and four men get out. Thr them -- JOHNSON, a tech-whiz; LETT, gangly, grim, and NOV a wiry guy in a baseball cap -- start setting up what loo be a high-tech missile launcher. The fourth man is...
A neatly groomed man, 40s, with a perpetually sour attitu looks like -- and is -- a lawyer.
(to Baker, re: Jim in
Jesus. Do you think maybe you could get him out of the fire? Unless you like that smell. 8.
The Ghost flies overhead, roaring.
Deakins and Hale check their screens.
(thinks of something) Weren't you going to call Taylor today about the Aurora Project?
Yeah. Turns out he wants people with more fighter hours.
What'd you say?
What could I say?
Jesus. You are such a pussy. You never fight for anything. Hale is stung. Pissed, he goes on the offensive.
Yeah, well you know what your problem is?
Because I said what your problem is, you're gonna--?

You fight too much. (Deakins look at him) Right? You said it yourself -- you should be at least Wing Commander by now. Maybe you would be if you didn't insist on telling people what they're doing wrong all the time.
I'm usually right though, aren't I? Hale shakes his head, grins. Deakins clicks on his mike.
Ghost 7 to McMurran. Hey, Wilkins, you old bag of dirt, your boys in Utah still awake? 9.
Establishing shot of McMurran Air Force Base.
Jammed with MEN looking at radar screens and computer mon COLONEL WILKINS, 50s, seen it all, talks over a headset.
Ready and waiting, Mr. Deakins. And tell our favorite hotshot, he's not gonna lose us tonight.
Deakins covers his mike, turns to Hale.
Wilkins says you won't lose them tonight.
Tell Colonel Wilkins I could fly this puppy up his ass without him knowing.
(grins, shakes his head; into helmet
Hale says ... if anyone can catch him it'd be you.
The Ghost makes a prominent blip on the screen.
Everyone get a fix! They're about to turn out the lights!
Deakins turns to Hale.
Ready, Major?
On your word.
Go to war. 10.
The left, labeled TAKE OFF, is lighted. The other two but are MISSION and LANDING. Hale pushes MISSION.
everything goes quiet.
The plane's running lights go out. The roar of the engine quickly drops to a low rushing sound. The plane in in ful stealth mode.
The Ghost's blip disappears.
Lost 'em on active! Who's still got 'em?
Got their heat signature, sir. (points to computer
Their engines may be cold, but the air is colder.
Half of the screen shows a waveform, like a voiceprint. T other half shows a triangle moving across a map of Colora
Deakins studies the maps on the computer screens.
Descend to 400 feet AGL. River valley approach.
Airspeed lock at point-seven Mach. Blue line descent on throttle to 400 feet AGL. Hale pulls back on the throttle. The plane descends.
Time to limbo down. How low can we go. 11.
The Ghost drops away from us, a stark black cut-out again moonlit Colorado landscape. The Colorado River is a windi silver ribbon five miles below.
Driving along the blacktop. The driver is not Baker. It's
Pretty, late 20s. Her radio squawks.
Terry? You been through the Needles entrance tonight?
(grabs mike, answers) No. Why?
Mrs. Parker called --
Oh, God. What is it this time? UFO abduction? Ritual human sacrifice?
She said she saw a bunch of trucks going through the Needles entrance an hour ago and thought they looked suspicious.
Yes, well, this is a woman who chopped off one of her own fingers because it'd "turned on her."
Thing is, she said one of the trucks was ours, and you're the only one out.
(arches eyebrow) She was probably hallucinating, but I'll check it out.
We feel the Ghost before we hear it. It rushes over, clos the river, below the ridgelines on either side of the val 12.
The triangle representing the Ghost disappears from a com screen.
Lost 'em.
Stay on it. They're gonna have to come up for air sooner or later.
Deakins reads his computer screens.
We're under the radar. Proceed to primary target. Hale hits a button, lets go of the stick -- they're on autopilot. It's a moment of peace. Hale looks out.
I tell people I became a pilot because I wanted to fly cool planes. It's also for this. When we're up here, I feel... closer ... I don't know.
To God? Is that what you're going to say? That you feel closer to God up here? (SNORTS)
Hell, Hale, with the payload we're carrying, we are God. Deakins notices something odd on his screen. He checks be the screen and what he can see through the windshield.
Hale, take a look out your side. I think our terrain following is off. It's got us two klicks from the left flank ridge. Hale turns to look out the window on his side.
Looking out the window. There's some movement in the refl in the glass. QUICK PULL FOCUS to see, distorted in the c of the window, Deakins reaching inside his flight suit. 13.
Turns his head back toward Deakins.
Deak, you can't smoke in here -- But then Hale sees it's not a cigarette that Deakins is p out of his flight suit. It's shiny, metal. It's...
And Deakins levels it right at Hale's head and his finger to squeeze the trigger.
Grabs Deakins' hand, pushing up as...
Pulls the trigger and the gun FIRES.
The bullet cuts a line through the top of his helmet, pun a hole in the window by his head.
Deakins goes for another shot, but Hale grabs the gun and up, sending bullets through the ceiling of the plane, int walls. Deakins forces the gun down, fires.
Tears through Hale's harness, blowing apart a shoulder st
Hale brings Deakins' gun hand hard against Hale's own hel Deakins yowls and the gun goes flying. Then Hale sees som
Is banking towards a ridge-line cliff wall.
Sees it, yanks on the stick.
Banks hard away from the cliff, just missing. 14.
Baker gives a sign. Johnson, standing beside the missile launcher-like device, hits a button. Instead of a missile brilliant light shoots out.
Buttons include ONE, TWO, LOCK, LEFT, RIGHT, OPEN, CLOSE, and RELEASE. Deakins presses ONE and TWO, then RIGHT.
No! He pulls at Deakins' arms.
Graphics of bomb racks rotate, the B-83 nukes -- labeled glowing red -- move into the bottom spot. The word RELEAS appears on the screen. Next to it, the word UNARMED flash
Deakins hits Hale with the back of his hand, knocking him Hale grabs Deakins' helmet, yanks it off his head and sma Deakins back with it. Hale keys the armament buttons.
The nukes rotate out of the release position. RELEASE and UNARMED disappear.
Deakins grabs a fire extinguisher, swings it, getting Hal the face. Hale is almost knocked out, blood running from nose.
Terry is standing by her truck, talking on the radio.
Clyde, tell Mrs. Parker that there's nothing weird going on. No truck, no UFOs, and, except for the odd human head on a stick, no sign of Satan. She feels it before she hears it or sees it. 15.
Rushes over Terry, no more than fifty feet above the grou jet-wash rocks the truck, almost knocks Terry down.
Holy shit.
Hale groggy, hears a loud click. He looks down to see...
AUTO to MANUAL. Deakins grabs Hale's EJECTION HANDLE.
Hale tries to push the handle down as Deakins pulls it up
Heads into the beacon light.
Hale and Deakins look at each other as the plane enters t light and the light, in SLOW MOTION, washes across their
Suddenly lets go of Hale's hand, then hits Hale hard unde chin with the fire extinguisher.
His head snaps back as Deakins pulls.
Pop, hiss like a huge vacuum-sealed can is being opened.
The ejection hatch blows and is ripped away by the wind.
As he rockets up out of the cockpit.
When the chute opens, he almost spills out because of the severed shoulder harness. He grabs the straps, holds on. 16.
Terry, on the radio with Clyde.
Somebody ejected!
Debris -- coffee cups, flight bags, anything not nailed d is whipping around the inside of the cabin. Deakins reach through the maelstrom, then reaches to the ARMAMENT BUTTO punches them.
The the clamps snap back and the two B-83s drop toward th
Deakins looks around, then gets an idea. He hits the LAND mission mode button and the cockpit lights up.
The Ghost starts popping up on everyone's screens. There' chorus of "I got em!" and "They're ba-a-a-ck!" Wilkins lo a screen, puzzled.
They're not due for another halfhour.
Deakins yells into his helmet mike as he gets ready to ej
(into helmet mike) This is Deakins! Hale lost it! I have to punch out! Deakins pulls his second handle. BLAM! WHOOSH! He's gone. hear and feel the plane dropping, screaming toward the ea
The Ghost's blip suddenly disappears from the screen. A c of "What the hell?" and "Jesus."
That's not good. 17.
Alarm horns blare. FIVE MEN are running to a waiting Blac helicopter. Waving the men on is Wilkins. The last man up
40s, short grey hair: he could snap your neck with a look Wilkins pats Rhodes on the shoulder and Rhodes jumps into
And it lifts up and flies off.
Hale lies, unconscious, his parachute whipping in the win
The helicopter glides over wind-whipped sand, searchlight Rhodes sits with MCKELLAR, the pilot. Lieutenants KELLY, and THOMAS are in the back.
Something glints in the searchlights but the helicopter m
Hold it. Come back. The lights sweep back, find...
Sticking out of the sand.
Establishing shot.

AKA "The War Room." Phones, faxes, computers, TV monitors backlit maps and coffee. Present are GENERALS (including Force General CREELEY), the CHAIRMAN OF THE JOINT CHIEFS STAFF (CHAIRMAN) and ASSISTANTS, all in uniform. They tur
Enters. Baird, 60s, is the White House Chief of Staff. Hi assistant stays in the b.g. as Baird walks in. 18.
So, do I wake the President?
Where is he -- Las Vegas?
(NODS)
Computer convention. Some information superhighway crap.
Let him sleep for now. (hands Baird a piece of paper) We're going out with this. Rick's team prepared it. The chairman nods toward RICK. Baird reads, mumbling.

"United States Air Force ... regrets to announce ... C-130 heavy-lift cargo plane ... down over the Utah desert ... status of crew not determined at this time ... yadda yadda ... Nice bullshit, Rick. Baird hands it to Rick, who starts for the door.
That's a mistake. The room quiets. All eyes on...
Baird's intensely competent assistant.
Giles ...?

Aviation Week has been following this plane's development for years. They have stringers who spend their vacations sitting in lawnchairs all night long by the Whiteman perimeter fence just in case one of these things takes off. The boys in those lawnchairs know one took off tonight. They're going to know when it doesn't come back. (MORE)

GILES (cont'd) And when we put out a press release saying a C-130 went down in Utah, they're going to put two and two together. Aviation week will run a story, everyone'll know what really happened and we're going to look real stupid. (BEAT)
We might as well tell the truth.
(mock shock) The truth? How the hell did you get this job? A few chuckles in the room. Baird looks at the Chairman - well? The Chairman thinks for a second, nods. Baird turns Rick.
Rewrite it. What Giles just said. Rick grits his teeth and hurries out. Baird looks at Gile
I want you in Utah. Now. Giles nods, heads out. Baird grabs his arm.
You scare me sometimes.
Hell, sir. Sometimes I scare myself. And out Giles goes.
Rhodes and his men are on the ground. Wind is whipping th sand. Rhodes is walking under part of the wing that is ex He's yelling into a headset microphone.
(into mike) Cockpit's empty! We're checking the payload!
Wilkins talks to Rhodes over the radio.
Watch your needles! 20.
Rhodes walks up to his men who are in the process of open bomb bay doors manually. The doors are open a foot. Rhode signals his men to stop. Rhodes steps up, shines a light the bomb bays.
Rhodes' light plays over the bomb racks -- empty.
(into headset mike) Colonel? (takes breath) We've got ourselves a Broken Arrow.
Stunned silence. They've just gotten the news. Baird does know what it means.
Broken Arrow?
That's what we call it when we lose a nuclear weapon.
Oh, Jesus. (thinks, shakes head) I don't know what's scarier -- losing nuclear weapons or the fact that it happens so often that you people have a term for it.
Wilkins is on the radio with Rhodes.
Find the nukes, Sam. But be careful. I know they say those eggs can't be cracked, but if your geigers pick up more rads than you'd get off a toaster, I want you out of there. Wilkins to the CORPORAL.
Get the teams in. I want Colonel Rhodes and his men backed up. 21.
Various views of a B-83 nuclear weapon. Creeley is briefi Baird on the nukes.
They dropped from a plane but they didn't go off...?
They have to be armed to detonate.
Then they're destroyed?
(shakes head) They're designed to survive crashes intact. They can lie in a pool of burning jet fuel for five hours without any problem.
How did this happen?

In his last transmission, Colonel Deakins said Major Hale lost control. He probably hit weapons release by accident. Believe me, when a plane's auguring in, you start pushing every button you can. Baird stands, looks at a picture of a Ghost shakes his he
Hell, we should take the cost of the plane out of major Hale's salary. Although I guess at two billion dollars a pop, that could take a while.
Hale is still unconscious, lying beside his parachute. Th the crunch of footsteps and a FIGURE looms over Hale. The reaches down to touch Hale's shoulder and...
Spins, grabs the shirt of the figure and cocks his arm ab punch. He hesitates when he sees it's... 22.
She seizes Hale's hesitation and punches him hard.

Hale is stunned. Terry starts to get up, reaching for her Hale strikes out with a leg, getting Terry in the gut, se her back. She hits the ground, still struggling for her g Hale gets up, runs, sprinting off over the rocky terrain.
Jarring, racing over rock and then...
Pulls up fast, almost not fast enough.
He's stopped right at the edge of a fifty foot drop.
That would be the wrong way.
Is walking slowly, calmy, up behind Hale, pistol out.
Turn around.
(TURNING)
Look, I --
(not interested) Gimme your hands. Hale sticks his hands behind him. Terry handcuffs them.
I'm going to tell you something I can't tell you. Terry puts away her gun, spins Hale around and starts mar him off.
There were nuclear weapons on that plane. The guy I was flying with is trying to steal them. Terry reacts to that, but keeps Hale moving. 23.
I have to stop him, and I need your help.
(STOPS)
Look, pal, all I know is, I saw you come down, I come in to help you and you grab me, kick me and run away.
I only ran because you punched me.
What, we're ten years old now? "You started it. No you started it."
He has men on the ground. I --
Save it. My dog's waiting for his breakfast. Terry starts to push Hale along again and...
Jumps up and through the handcuffs.
Reaches for her revolver, but...
Grabs it from her, puts it to-her head, but not before...
Whips a knife from her belt and puts it under Hale's chin
Don't move. A beat while they catch their breath.
This isn't a stand-off, okay? I've got a gun.
Yeah, well, I never keep my gun loaded. Terry taps her belt. 24.
A line of bullets.
Terry holds out her hand. Hale lets the revolver swing do his finger. Just as Terry takes it...
Moves fast, grabs Terry's knife hand, then kicks her legs from under her. Hale lands on top of her, still holding h knife hand, putting the knife to her throat.
I'm telling you the truth.
This is a good way to convince me.
I could kill you now. Right? Terry nods, bewildered and more than a little scared. Hale lets go of Terry's hand holding the knife.
I need your help. Terry looks at Hale for a long moment. She's still holdin knife. She exhales, then sticks the knife in the dirt.
The helicopter flies low. Rhodes looks at a device on his
Green, like a radar screen. It's blank, and then two dots appear on the outer edge of the screen.
Got 'em!
Terry unlocks Hale's handcuffs.
I've got a radio in the truck. We can call McMurran and get the Marines in here. 25.
(shakes head) Deakins'll be monitoring any radio transmissions out of here. (off her look) That's what I'd do.
Who is this guy?
(a flash of the horrible betrayal he
Someone I would've trusted with my life. (BEAT)
You've gotta get to a phone.
Me? What are you going to do? (no answer, she
Wait. You're gonna go after this guy? Isn't he going to have a lot guns and shit? I don't want to sound insulting or anything, but ... you're just a pilot.
I don't have any choice. The nukes are my responsibility. Besides... (pulls something from
I do have one thing going for me.
What's that? Hale sticks...
Under a rock.
The last thing in the world he expects is for me to come after him. Hale walks off into the light of the rising sun. Terry lo the $20 bill.
The helicopter is parked at the edge of a deep crevice. 26.
Rhodes comes down the last few feet of rope to the bottom crevice. Kelly, Thomas and Reed are waiting, shining ligh a B-83 lying in the dirt, all in one piece.
(into mike) We've got one intact. (to his men) Let's go find the other one. Rhodes starts off along the bottom of the crevice.
McKellar is sitting in the pilot's seat, eating a candy b turns at the unexpected sound of a truck-driving up.
climbs up the slope toward the helicopter.
Grabs his rifle, hops out of the helicopter.
Are in the Humvee. Novacek sticks his head out.
Hey, you guys need any help?
It's an Air Force training exercise, sir. I'm going to have to ask you to leave.
Hey, no problem. We just --
Whips out a silenced rifle and shoots.
Barely has time to raise his rifle before he's hit. He dr
Drives up fast.
Get out. Johnson wears radio headgear. Pritchett is furio 27.
Picks up McKellar's half-eaten candy bar, takes a bite.
(to Novacek) Any sign of Deakins? Novacek, mouth full, shakes his head.
He better be dead.
Sorry to disappoint you, Mr. Pritchett. They all look over to see...
Walk out of the shadows, smoking a cigarette. While soldi with his men, Deakins is courteous and polite with Pritch
You said nothing would go wrong!
Well, point of fact, nothing has.
You didn't drop the nukes where you were supposed to!

Ah, but we always planned on the search and rescue team finding the weapons for us, and they have. Mr. Pritchett, I really have thought of everything. Johnson walks up, pointing to his radio headgear.
Newsflash. Two gunships just left from McMurran and they're headed this way.
You thought of that?
That'll take care of itself.
What about the other pilot? We saw him eject. 28.
You don't have to worry about Major Hale. He's probably hiding behind a rock somewhere, praying I don't find him.
Someone else might find him. (off Deakins' look) A Ranger called her base, said she saw a pilot come down and was gonna go look for him. Deakins thinks it over, turns to Novacek.

Get ready. You'll go when the clean-up's done. Novacek nods, goes to the helicopter. Ext. Canyonlands - 4wd trail Hale and Terry are hurrying along a 4WD trail toward Terr truck. Terry taken a look at Hale's ripped and torn fligh
Is that the new uniform?
Yeah. Less constricting.
The dayshift guy left some work clothes in the truck. You can have them if you want. Hale nods. His feet crunch on something.
Don't walk there.
Don't walk where?
On that black stuff. That's cryptogamic soil. It's very fragile. One footprint takes centuries to repair.
That's a new one. Endangered dirt. Terry gives Hale a look. 29.
Rhodes, Reed, Thomas and Kelly move along the shadowy cre
Novacek flips switches in the helicopter, getting ready t up. Deakins reaches in, flips off a switch marked COM LIN
Rhodes hears the connection go dead. He taps his headset.
Hello? McMurran? Come in. Suddenly, there's a soft popping sound and Reed drops.
Reed? What the --? Rhodes looks down, sees blood on Reed. Before he can say another word, there's a fusillade of soft popping sounds silenced bullets ricochet off the rock around them. Thoma down.
Silence from the speakers.
Sam? Sam, are you there? Sam?
Lett aims a sniper's rifle down into the crevice. He flip switch and a red laser beam stabs out from the scope.
Rhodes and Kelly are pressed against the crevice wall.
Dances along the wall, heading for them.
Raises his pistol and shoots at the source of the laser.
Lett pitches back, dead. 30.
Pritchett looks at Deakins -- another part of the plan? D is unperturbed. He's holding an overnight bag. He unzips
Rhodes whispers to Kelly.

We'll open up the access panels, put in a couple grenades. The nukes won't go nuclear, but they will go dirty. I won't lie and say we'll be all right. We won't. But if we're gonna go, might as well take those bastards with us. Rhodes scrambles off.
Just one thing, sir.
(TURNS)
What?
This. Kelly opens fire with his rifle. Rhodes is thrown back, d Kelly yells up top.
Done! Kelly grabs the rope, climbs fast.
Mr. Pritchett looks at Deakins, surprised. Deakins -- put on new clothes -- just grins. Deakins takes...
From his flightsuit and puts it into his shirt pocket.
Climbs into view.
Kelly's voice comes in over the speaker. 31.
(TERRIFIED)
Colonel Wilkins? You there?
Who is this?
It's Lieutenant Kelly, sir.
What happened, Kelly?
Kelly talks over the helicopter's radio mike. Deakins is him, shaving with an electric shaver.
Colonel Rhodes is dead, sir! They're all dead!
What happened? Deakins puts the shaver to the radio mike. There's a wash static. Deakins pulls the shaver away, nods to Kelly.

It's the nuke, sir! It's open! Wide open! Oh, God, what am I going to do?! Deakins puts the shaver to the mike again -- more static. reaches into the helicopter and flips off the COM LINK sw then backs away, shaving. He nods to Novacek, who fires u helicopter.
Wilkins slumps in his chair.
Call back the teams and get me the Room. We're gonna need NEST in here.
Novacek lifts off in the helicopter and flies away. Deakins turns to Kelly and applauds his performance.
Brought a tear to my eye. 32.
I'd just like to thank the members of the Academy.
(to Deakins) I hope you've got another surprise up your sleeve. If I'm not mistaken, there are two attack helicopters headed this way.
Not any longer. They look at him; he taps his radio headgear.
They've just been recalled.

You see, Mr. Pritchett, they think they've got an exposed core. They'll want to get a satellite to take a look, but it'll take ninety minutes minimum to shift the orbit. Until then? Well, people get a little weird when it comes to radiation. No one'll have the balls to come near here unless it's NEST -- the Nuclear Emergency Search Teams --and it'll take the nearest team at least two hours to get out here, and we only need an hour to reach our connection with the transport squad. (GRINS)
Not that I'm not delighted with your presence, but you really don't need to be here.
Hale and Terry are riding in Terry's truck. Terry drives. is wearing work clothes. After some silence...
What's your dog's name?
Bear. I was going to call him Death, so I could say things like, "I walk with Death," and "Death chewed my boots," but I chickened out. You?
No dog. 33.
Do you have a name, or is that classified? Before Hale can answer...
Rises up in front of them, Novacek piloting. Novacek thum button and machine guns on the sides open up.
Terry jumps on the brakes. She and Hale bail out as...
is riddled with bullets and explodes.
Sprint up the trail.
We've gotta hide!
Follow me! Terry leads Hale up a short slope. Hale scrambles over th and is stunned. Terry runs out onto an open expanse -- no
Hide where?
Novacek grins, shoots.
Looks at the helicopter as the bullets whistle in. When h turns back, Terry's gone.
What the --?
Come on! Hale runs in the direction of her voice.
Aiming at Hale's back. But then Hale suddenly drops from 34.
Arms flailing, drops fifteen feet, to deep sand.
This way. Terry runs. Hale follows.
How do you --?
(looks back, still
I'm a Ranger. I've been over these trails a million times. Not looking, Terry runs straight into a wall, smacks her and drops like a rock.
Novacek can't see his prey. He gets an idea and reaches b
Terry is trying to get her eyes to focus.
Please don't tell anyone I did that.
Novacek has a box of grenades beside him. He pulls the pi a grenade and drops it.
Hale is helping Terry to her feet as BOOM -- the first gr goes off. They run.
Chases them, strafing them. BOOM! -- a grenade goes off i front of them. They run back. They're cornered. Hale look around, looks up.
Can you climb up?
Yeah ...?
Give me your gun. 35.
Terry climbs up into view of...
Who sees her.
Pull herself up, stands, hands up.
Novacek swivels the helicopter around.
This has nothing to do with me.
Tell me where he is!
Is down in the fissure, pointing the revolver straight up helicopter hovering right overhead, figuring out where to
Blackhawk ... Moved pilot seat back a foot ... Puts him right about ... here. Hale hesitates -- he's never shot at someone before -- th takes a breath and starts shooting.
The bullets fly up from below. One hits Novacek. He slump pushing the joystick to one side.
Starts to lean over sideways.
Is surprised -- it worked!'
Watches in horror as...
Angle toward her, slicing the air as the helicopter tips 36.
Dives and rolls over the edge of the cliff as...
Hit the rock, sparking, grinding, right over Terry's head blades stop dead. But the torque of the motor brings...
Up and over, in a high arc.
Looks up.
Is swinging over fast and the tail rotor is coming right
Hale runs up, grabs Terry, pulls her to her feet as...
Swings down, rotor spinning. It digs into the dirt and sa split-second after...
Run clear.
Deakins and Pritchett watch a fireball from the exploding helicopter rise up in the distance.
We don't have to worry about the other pilot? Deakins shakes his head.
Then how come the helicopter crashed?
(a flicker of worry) Pilot error. Deakins turns and walks away, over to... 37.
Who have taken the three-foot, pointed, front section off nuke. They are loading them into the back of one Humvee. Pritchett walks up behind Deakins, still nagging.
Tell me again how I don't need to be here.
Mr. Pritchett, I understand your concerns. You and your associates gave me a lot of money to mount this operation. But they're getting ten times that back if we succeed.
If we succeed?

All I can do is my part. We've got the weapons, we're ... (checks watch) ... seventeen minutes ahead of schedule and everything will be in place within two hours. But I can't guarantee that the assholes in Washington won't do something stupid like not pay.
What if they don't?
Then the next census for this region is going to show a very sudden drop in population.
Giles enters and is brought over to Wilkins.
Colonel Wilkins? I'm Giles Prentice. (they shake hands) My word from your search and rescue team?
I'm sorry. Picked up any radiation? Wilkins shakes his head.
That's kind of strange -- if there's an exposed core out there.
Point?
Probably nothing. I asked for a transcript of the last cockpit transmission...? Wilkins nods to a CORPORAL who hands some papers to Giles reads them quickly.
I don't know what you expect to find.
We see COLONEL DEAKINS: "This is Deakins! Hale lost it! O God! I have to punch out!"
You know these guys? The pilots?
Just on the radio. Never met 'em. Why?
(looks up) What if this wasn't pilot error?
Baird has put Giles on speaker phone. The people in the Situation Room exchange looks.
No rhetorical questions, Giles. Spit it out. 39.

head_text.subj: CROSSCUT WITH GILES IN MCMURRAN CONTROL ROOM

text: In the last transmission from the plane, Colonel Deakins said Major Hale lost it and made the plane crash. We all assumed that meant pilot error. But what if Deakins meant Hale made the plane crash. Murmurs of "That's insane" "No way" fill the room.
Why would he do that?
Two nuclear weapons would be worth a hell of a lot of money.
To whom? Son, there are easier ways for someone to buy nuclear weapons. You go to one of the old Soviet republics, you can get one for the price of a BMW.
I meant they'd be worth a lot of money to us. How much would we pay to get them back? To make sure they weren't used in this country? A flurry of looks around the room.
Hold on, hold on. (to Creeley) These nukes have codes or something that prevent people from using them.
Of course.
No one has these codes -- outside of the President and you guys.
Access to the codes requires the highest security --
I mean, not even the pilots have these codes, right? 40. Creeley starts to stammer. Baird slumps. The chairman tur
(to an assistant) Where's that NEST team now?
They just took off.
A sleek, very serious-looking helicopter.
SIX very serious-looking SOLDIERS are in black radiation listening to COLONEL HUNT, 45, over headsets.

Listen up, sportsfans. Word is, this particular broken arrow has broken open. Our ETA Utah is ninety-six minutes. I want everyone to take that time to triple-check the seams and seals on their E-suits. Let's go!
Giles looks at Wilkins.
You think I'm nuts. You don't think NEST or the satellite will find anything weird.
That's right. (BEAT)
But it wouldn't hurt to get some gunships fueled just in case. Wilkins reaches for a phone. Giles smiles.
The helicopter wreck burns. Hale looks over the terrain.
How do they get out of here?
Get out? I don't think that helicopter's going anywhere. 41.
Deak'd have a back-up. He'd be prepared.
If they've got trucks they could take the four-wheel-drive trail we were on.
He wouldn't want to go towards town.
He could go to the river. Hale looks at Terry -- that's exactly what Deakins would
The two Humvees roll along the narrow, twisting trail.
Kelly drives, Deakins beside him, Johnson and Pritchett i
You a fan of boxing, Mr. Pritchett?
I think it's barbaric.
Me, too! I love it! Two men trying to do as much damage to the other as he can. As basic as you can get, don't you think?
I think it should be banned.

So do I! God, wouldn't that make it more exciting? Having to go into dark alleys and basements to see a fight? I bet we see eye-to- eye on a lot of things, Mr. Pritchett. Deakins grins; Mr. Pritchett steams.
Hale and Terry stand on an outcropping overlooking the 4W 42.
The two Humvees make their way along the trail.
See the one in front? It just has a driver? They wanted to keep the weight down. It has the nukes. Hale takes Terry's gun from her.
You gonna shoot out the tires?
Humvees can reseal and inflate with the flick of a switch. That's why Deak chose 'em. Terry looks at Hale -- then what is he going to do?
I'm gonna steal it. (checks gun) You get to a phone and call McMurran.
The nearest phone is a two-hour walk.
Then you better start walking.
Look, I know my way around here. You're gonna need me.
(very serious) I appreciate what you've done so far. But now it gets hairy. Go to the phone. He scrambles off over the rock.
Come around a corner. The trail hugs the face of a ten-fo high cliff. Suddenly, from off the cliff...
Jump down onto the roof of the lead Humvee. Hale looks at Terry, angry. But before he can say anything... 43.
Baker swerves, trying to throw them off. He pulls out a p shoots up through the ceiling.
Bullets punch up. Hale pulls out the gun. It falls from h hand. Terry grabs it as a sharp swerve sends...
Flying. He lands hard behind the Humvee.
Deakins points at Hale, getting to his feet.
Run him down.
Sprints after the leading Humvee. Deakins' Humvee closes
Looks back, sees Hale's predicament.
Here! She slides the pistol along the truck roof.
Grabs the gun out of the air as...
Slams on the brakes.
Comes flying off the top, landing on the hood, barely hol
Is going to be crushed between the Humvees. He jumps up, turning, as the bumpers come together. He lands on the ta facing backwards and fires into Deakins' windshield.
Kelly ducks below the dash and slams on the brakes but De doesn't flinch. The bullets bounce off the glass --bullet 44.
Baker sticks his gun out the window and aims at Terry and to pull the trigger when he stops, feeling a gun against back of his head.
Is behind him. Hale gets into the passenger seat.
Gimme the gun and get out.
(SMIRKING)
I don't know. I think we got ourselves a little stand-off.
No, we don't. Hale shoots Baker in the thigh. Baker howls.
Reaches forward and grabs Baker's gun as...
Kicks Baker out of the Humvee.
Bad timing for him. He tumbles out, right in front of...
And is run over.
Holds the steering wheel, yells to Terry.
You drive!
Climbs into the Humvee, takes the wheel from Hale. She ja Baker's gun into her belt.

I'd yell at you for coming after me, but you did just save my life. 45. There's a look between them, then Hale climbs into the ba finds what he is looking for -- a jerry can of gasoline a emergency tool box.
What're you doing, Hale?
Hale keeps his back to the other Humves. He pulls gaffer' off a roll, tears it with his teeth, grabs...
Out of the tool kit.
Maybe he'll set off a nuke. That'd show us.
Hale tosses the jerry can of gasoline out the back of the
Flies through the air. There's a burning flare taped to t side of the plastic can.
As the plastic of the can bubbles and melts and...
Stop! But it's too late and...
Explodes.
Skids to a stop, showered with burning gasoline. Deakins his men bail out. Kelly, Johnson and Pritchett run for co
Coolly grabs a fire extinguisher and starts spraying. 46.
Hale climbs up into the front seat. Terry looks at him, genuinely impressed.
We need somewhere to hide.
(THINKS)
I know a place.
Deakins keeps spraying the burning Humvee with foam.

Terry and Hale have taken the Humvee to the parking area front of an abandoned mine. The winch on the Humvee strai The cable is attached to the handles on the padlocked met doors. The doors are slowly pulling out, groaning.

It was a copper mine, barely squeaking along for years. They shut it-down a few months ago when they hit an underground river. The hinges on the metal doors buckle and snap and the doo loose. Hale shuts down the winch, unhooks it from the doo He motions for Terry to drive it in.

Terry drives the Humvee into the mineshaft entrance. Hale a flashlight to look around. He finds a switch a flips it gas generator comes to life. Another click and lights com Now they can see the rest of the entry area, including a mesh-enclosed elevator. As Terry looks around, Hale grabs Humvee radio, tries to tune in other frequencies, gives u
They hardwired in their frequency. We can't call out.
What are we gonna do? Hale goes to the back of the Humvee, pulls down the tailg
I'm gonna take away Deakins' reason for being here. Hale grabs a screwdriver from the tool kit and pries open panel on the side of one of the B-83s. 47.
There's an LCD DISPLAY, a NUMERIC KEYPAD and a CLOCK show current time. The keys are oversized and brightly colored
Fisher-Price makes nuclear weapons?
They're designed to be used by guys wearing gloves in Alaska. He reaches in, hits a key and the LCD display lights up.
These nukes have security codes. If you enter the wrong code three times, the nuke goes dead -- all the circuitry shorts out and shuts down. Kind of like the security systems with car radios.
And people say the public doesn't benefit from defense spending.
(GRINS)
Hand me the radio. Terry goes for the radio mike. Hale sees something.
Sticking out from under one of the nukes.
Pulls it out, looks at it.
It's from "St. Judes Hospital, Radiology Department."
Hale turns to Terry as she pulls over the radio mike.
Where's St. Judes Hospital?
The fire is out. The radio crackles.
Deak -- you there? 48. Deakins and Kelly look at each other.
Ding, ding, ding, Deak. We're starting a new round. You took the first couple, but I've got you on the ropes now, you son of bitch. Deakins gets in the passenger side, grabs the radio mike.
Hey, there. What was that last part? There was some static. (clicks off mike; to
Find them. (to Pritchett and
Let's go! Johnson pulls out a radiation detector scanner like the o Rhodes used. Kelly and Pritchett get back in the vehicle.
Kelly drives Deakins' Humvee along the trail as they talk
I know you're stalling while you try to find the nukes with your scanner, but you're gonna be too late. Hear that? Hale holds the radio mike up to the keypad as he enters n
I'm entering the wrong code, you bastard. A couple more times and these are gonna be useless to you.
You really got me there. I sure didn't think of that. Hale slows down -- something's wrong -- Deakins doesn't c

All that time we spent in the cockpit together and you think I'm stupid? I got some new boards and circuits from a friend at Pantex. But nice try. Hale curses to himself. Terry looks at him. He shakes his they're in trouble. 49.
You know, Hale, I thought of asking you to join me on this. You wanna know why I didn't?
Because I would've said no?

I would've just killed you if you said no. I was more afraid you'd say yes. Because I knew I couldn't count on you. You can pretend you've got guts, but when and if it comes down to it, you're gonna run off crying like a little girl.
You better hope that's true, Doak. Because I've got the nukes, and there's nothing to stop me from entering the right code, if you know what I mean.
(flash of worry) You wouldn't do that.
Nah. You're right. I wouldn't have the guts. END SPLIT-SCREEN. Hale drops the mike; looks at the eleva
How deep is this mine?
I don't know. A couple thousand feet.
That's deep enough. Hale opens the elevator gate.
For what?
A nuclear explosion. Terry's jaw drops. 50.
Kelly drives the blackened Humvee as fast as he can. John looks at his scanner, grins.
Got it! They're --
In the mine. (off their looks) I could tell he was inside something. There was an echo.
Hale hurries to the back of the Humvee.
We can still hide them!
He's got a scanner. He'd find them.
You're talking about setting off a nuclear weapon!
They set them off underground in Nevada all through the fifties and sixties. There's no risk.
Tell it to the two-headed cows. Hale grabs the straps around one of the nukes, pulls. He barely move the thing. He turns to Terry.
No! I am not helping you set off a nuclear weapon.
We won't be down there when it goes off. This isn't a suicide mission.
(IMPATIENT)

All right. Fine. Though I think you should know, before I ejected, I heard Deakins say the nukes were going to be used to wipe out the last few remaining handicapped gay whales. Terry looks at him -- you asshole. Hale looks at her, ver serious.
I need your help. Terry thinks, shakes her head, steps up and grabs the nuk
The Humvee takes the turn-off to the mine entrance.
Hale and Terry are going down with the nukes.
When we get to the bottom we'll have to get away from this shaft. It'll limit the amount of radiation released into-the atmosphere.
Deakins's Humvee comes into the clearing. The Humvee stop Deakins and Kelly jump out, followed by Pritchett and Joh
The elevator comes down. Hale slides open the gate. He an Terry drag the nukes out.
We'll each drag one down a tunnel?
No. I'm only going to set off one. We'll leave the other one here. It'll be buried under a billion tons of rock. They are startled when the elevator starts going up behin
We better hurry. (nods down tunnel) Let's try down there. 52. They start hauling the nuke down the tunnel.
Deakins, Pritchett, Kelly and Johnson wait by the elevato
I can't wait to see how this fits into your plan. Deakins' charm peels away for an instant and he fixes Pri with a stare. Pritchett shrinks back.
Baird, the Chairman and the others are watching large TV monitors. Creeley walks them through what they're looking
A wide-view, bird's-eye, thermal image of rocky terrain.

This is the KH-12 satellite's infrared view of the area. An exposed nuclear core would be relatively hot -- it'd show as a circle of bright white. As you can see, there's nothing. The only heat signatures we found were these. The image changes. There are four blotches, glowing a dul
What's --?
We think it's Colonel Rhodes and his men. Their bodies. A look between Baird and the Chairman. The Chairman reach a phone.
Wilkins is on the phone. Giles looks at him.
I understand, sir.
(WHISPERS)
Was I right? Wilkins nods. Giles grins smugly for about half a second, realizes what it really means. 53.
Oh, shit.
(into phone) I've got ten ships ready to go ... We should be hearing from NEST any minute now.
Flying over Canyonlands.
Deakins, Kelly and Johnson are in the elevator. Kelly hol small metal briefcase.
Hale and Terry have stopped at the end of a tunnel. Hale opened the guts of the nuke. He's pulling out a chip.
How do you know how to do this?
Pilots who fly with nuclear weapons have standing orders to ... (quoting from the
... "retrieve if possible, disable if necessary and destroy if we must," and destroy I must. He stands, looks around. He sees...
Screwed into the cross beaus on the ceiling.
I'm gonna need your belt and one of your socks.
The elevator descends into view. Deakins, Kelly and Johns out. They see the other nuke lying there.
Send it up?
(shakes head) Let's take care of Hale first. Spread out. 54.
In one hand Hale holds Terry's sock, filled with sand. Hi other hand grips the eyebolt. Terry is giving Hale a log straining under the weight.
Take your time. Really. Hale has pushed the open end of the sock through the eyeb tightens a belt around the open end of the sock.
Okay. Terry lets Hale down. Hale picks up a big rock and loops free end of the belt around it. Then he picks up a smalle
One chip has been pulled out of a circuit board. Hale ver gingerly lays the small rock on top of the chip.

We make a small hole in the sock, and when enough sand drains out -- and we're hopefully in New Mexico -- the sock is pulled through the eyebolt, the rock drops... (re: smaller rock) ... hitting the rock on this chip, closing the firing circuit and that's it. Hale finishes putting the small rock in position. He stan
How much time are we going to have?
I don't know precisely. This isn't a Swiss sock. Ten minutes, maybe -- Hale is cut off by...
Flying in, ricocheting off the rock walls, fired by...
Thirty yards down the tunnel. 55.
Dive to the ground. They pull pistols, start shooting.
One of Johnson's bullets cuts through it.
Feels sand hitting his face, looks up.
Sand is draining out of the sock very fast.
Reaches up to grab the big rock, but Johnson sends a spra bullets in. Terry grabs Hale.
Come on!
The sock -- More bullets. Terry pulls Hale. They run down a side pass Hale and Terry fire back at Johnson as they run out of si
Shoots after them, then runs up to the weapon. He reaches the rock, stops -- maybe that'll set it off.
The last sand pours out; the sock is sucked through the e
Drops fast toward the nuke.
Grabs it, stopping it just in time. The hand belongs to..
He looks at Johnson in disgust, exhales, and tosses the r pulls out a walkie-talkie, clicks on, talks into it. 56.
We're at the end of tunnel three. (clicks off; to
You two get this one set. I'll take the other one up.
Running along a tunnel.
What do we do?
Beat 'em back to the elevator. Stop 'em from getting out. Terry nods. They hurry off around a corner and are met by
Fired by...
With his Uzi.
Run back down the side tunnel, bullets winging off the ro around them, shooting back. Hale starts shooting out the lights, plunging the tunnel into darkness.
Slows down.
The bit with the sock was good. I like it. Still, I'm gonna use the the Field Expedient Tactical Timer. It's a little more precise. (BEAT)
See, Hale -- you aren't the only one who's thought of setting off a nuke in this mine.
Kelly is there with Johnson. Kelly flips on a lamp on a headstrap, giving him better light as he opens up the met briefcase he's been carrying.
An elaborate electronic timer. 57.
Deakins pulls out a fresh clip.

I need a demonstration. Otherwise, some swinging dick in Washington is going to say I don't have the balls or the ability to set off a nuclear weapon. I'm gonna show these puppies I'm ready, willing and able. Hell, I'm eager. Deakins jams in his clip, walks into the dark part of the
In the dark, waiting to ambush Deakins and then...
Opens fire -- but not at Hale and Terry -- at the cable a the ceiling connecting the lights. The cable snaps and electrical sparks shoot out, flooding the tunnel with lig showing...
Suddenly exposed to Deakins' fire. The bullets whiz in.
The muzzle flashes from his Uzi give away his position an and Terry's bullets scream in at him. He backs around a c
Take cover. It's a stand-off.
Well, Hale, I better be going. Look at it this way, partner. If you wanted to get closer to God, you are about to get your wish. Hale hears Deakins' footsteps start off.
You're gonna ransom Salt Lake City, aren't you? The footsteps stop.
What makes you think that? 58.
That's where St. Judes Hospital is. You're gonna hide the nukes near the radiology department so they won't show up an any satellite radiation scans.
I'm impressed.
How much are you gonna ask for?

Enough. I've got a broker in Stockholm. Monday morning he's going to buy me five percent of Volvo. For the rest of my days I'm going to live off the dividends, happy in the knowledge I'm helping to build the safest car in the world.
So that's it? You're just doing 'this for the money? I'm kind of disappointed.
Why would you do it, Hale?
That's the thing -- I wouldn't.
If you were me.

If I were you...? (thinks, starts in) Because ... because I got passed over for promotion and goddamnit I'm going to show the bastards that I'm smarter than them all. (getting angry) Because ... everyone's selling out and cashing in, so why not me? (ANGRIER)
Because ... because my ex-wife was sleeping around. Because my parents abused me. Because I ate some sugar. (MORE)
HALE (cont'd) (FURIOUS)
Because I don't like Mondays. (takes a breath,

It's all bullshit, Deak. There are no reasons. Not really. There's no difference between you and the guy who shoots up the schoolyard with an M-16. You both think you have reasons. You both think you were wronged. The truth? You're both just fucked in the head.
Grim, evil -- fades into darkness as he turns and walks o
They hear footsteps, receding. Hale bolts out of their hi spot. Terry follows.
Deakins gets to the elevator, drags the other nuke in, sh gate and starts up.
Kelly finishes keying in numbers into the nuke timer. An light comes on and...
Starts ticking down from ton minutes.
Grab their guns and run.
The elevator comes up. Deakins drags out the nuke, hits t DOWN button, shuts the gate. The elevator descends.
Mr. Pritchett!
Hale and Terry are waiting for the elevator to come down
Run in. A half-second of surprise is broken when... 60.
Comes down.
Make a move toward the elevator, but...
Unload with their Uzis.
Back around a corner, side by side, shooting their pistol
Is shot, drops.
Grabs Johnson's Uzi and, firing both guns, backs to the elevator, kicks open the gate with his foot and gets insi hits the UP button with the butt of one of the guns and t elevator starts to rise.
Step out of the tunnel and fire on the climbing elevator.
Seven minutes and counting.
Deakins and Pritchett get the nuke into the back of the H
We can go back, try to shut it down.
We don't know the code, and Deak'd have it wired to blow if we so much as look at it funny.
Then we're... Hale looks at her. 61.
I'm sorry. I shouldn't've let you come.
Oh, God. Hale takes Terry in his arms, holds her.
I ... I just hope someone remembers to feed my dog. Hale nods, hugs Terry. Terry starts to say something else Hale puts a finger to his lips -- he's heard something -- distant rushing.
Come on. Hale pulls Terry, running, down the far tunnel.
What're you --?
You said they shut down the mine when they hit an underground river.
Deakins slams the tailgate on the Humvee shut. From the distance, he and Pritchett hear the whump-whump-whump of helicopter. Deakins motions Pritchett to stay.
Deakins comes out, looks up, sees...
Coming toward him, two miles away.
Hunt sees something, points.
Ten o'clock! In the clearing!
The blackened Humvee and Deakins by the mine entrance. 62.
Hale and Terry run up. The tunnel comes to an end at a bi hole. The rushing sound comes from the hole. They step up to the edge and look down.
Dark water rushes by ten feet below them.
Any idea where it goes?
No. They look at each other. They don't have any choice. They flick on their flashlights and jump. They-hit the water a swept from view.
Deakins enters, motions for Pritchett to get into the Hum
Get in. We're leaving.
(re: Kelly and
Aren't you going to wait for them?
No time. And if they get out, they might talk. Fortunately, there's something wrong with the elevator. Deakins opens fire with his Uzi on the generator. Sparks and the thing shuts down.
Kelly is jarred when the elevator stops and the lights di
Deakins and Pritchett drive out of the mine in the Humvee Deakins punches the trip odometer, setting it to zeroes.
Kelly switches on his headlamp.
Wrong person to screw with, Deak. 63. He pulls open the gate and climbs down.
Kelly swings under the elevator.
I know the goddamn code, asshole. He grabs the cable trailing off below the elevator and st sliding down it into the darkness.
Two minutes and counting.
Hale and Terry are being sucked along through the fast, turbulent water. Their flashlights show...
Jutting down like knives, ready-to rip then open.
Dodge them, push off, duck under. And then they notice th
Is getting lower, getting closer to the surface of the wa They're running out of breathing room. Three feet, two fe one foot. They take big breaths, maybe their last, and they're...
Tumbling along, pulled at by the eddies, flashlights show their faces -- they are running out of air. And then, the light above them in the water.
Lungs bursting, they start kicking up.
Terry and Hale come to the surface, coughing, sucking in
Deakins drives fast along the 4WD trail, glancing in his sideview mirror at... 64.
Closing in on him.
Is holding on tight as Deakins drives wildly.
I think I've finally figured out your plan. Those guys in the helicopter are going to kill us, but we're going to rise from the dead and
Very suddenly and very violently lashes out. The side of hand hits Pritchett in the throat.
Gags silently, suddenly unable to get any air. He pulls a throat, even pounds himself in the back of the neck. No g slowly slumps, dying, skin turning blue.
Maybe now you'll shut up.
Kelly is running as fast as he can, headlamp lighting the
Thirty seconds and counting.
Hale and Terry are swimming toward the bank.
Deakins barrels along in the Humvee, the NEST helicopter closer behind him.
Deakins has a thought and looks over at Pritchett, dead, by the seatbelt.
I just realized I've never killed anyone before. I mean, I dropped bombs on Baghdad, but never face to face. (MORE)
DEAKINS (cont'd) (thinks about it,
I don't know what the big deal is.
Eighteen seconds left.
Runs up, starts entering numbers into the timer keypad.
The NEST helicopter closes fast on Deakins. They are a co hundred feet above him, a quarter mile back.
Let him know we're here!
A line of bullets kicks up dust in front of Deakins' Humv
Deakins looks at...
It clicks over from 2.9 to 3.0 miles.
Grins, steps on the brakes.
The Humvee stops and Deakins gets out, arms above his hea
A hundred feet in the air, slowly coming in toward Deakin
Eleven, ten, nine...
Punches in the last two numbers of the code then ENTER. 66.
It stops with seven seconds left. The amber light goes of the red light comes on.
Sits back on the floor, takes a breath.
Deakins is watching the helicopter. Strangely, he is grin Then the camera CLOSES IN fast on...
He's holding a small black box. He presses a button and..
Kelly hears a click. He looks over at...
The red light goes out. The amber light comes on. A split later, the green light comes on.
Oh shit. The screen goes white.
Watching the helicopter, listening to Hunt over the louds
Do not move or you will be fired --
Rises up beneath Deakins.
The ripples of the shockwave shoot out from the mine, sha dust and dirt into the air with an incredible, deafening
Fly ten feet into the air. 67.
There's a roar of static over everyone's headphones and t every light, every piece of electronic equipment shuts do
No...! They plummet.
Terry and Hale are pulling themselves out of the water wh shockwave hits, knocking them off their feet.
Wilkins and Giles hear the sudden rumble and then the sho hits, knocking stuff off desks, swinging lamps.
Deakins and the Humvee land. In the b.g...
Drops out of sight behind a rock formation. There's an explosion and a ball of fire shoots up.
Terry looks over at Hale -- holy shit.
The lamps are still swinging.
That's all we need. A goddamn earthquake.
Son, I was at the Nevada Test site in the fifties. That wasn't an earthquake.
Deakins picks himself up.
(to himself) At least I know they work.
Wilkins grabs a phone. Giles is pacing, freaked. 68.
(into phone) Get me the Room.
I have to get out of here.
You're going to be fine. It was underground. (into phone) Colonel Wilkins for General Creeley.
How do you know?

For one thing, if it was above ground, it wouldn't have caused the same kind of ground tremor. For another, if it was above ground, we'd all be blind and dying. (into phone) Sir, we've just had a detonation.
Bedlam. People yelling. The Chairman is huddling with Bai
How'd that happen?
I don't know, but thank God it happened underground.
What do we do now?

First thing we do is put a huge goddamn lid on this thing. With all due respect to your boy Giles and his belief in honesty as the best policy, from now on and until the end of time, what happened in Utah tonight was an earthquake. All right? Baird nods.
The Humvee races along the trail. 69.
Deakins and the dead Pritchett motor along. Deakins turns Pritchett as if Pritchett had just asked him a question.

The helicopter? It was hit by EMP. Electromagnetic pulse. It's released in a nuclear detonation. It wipes out anything electronic for miles. That"s another reason I wanted to set off a nuke. I knew it'd bring down any helicopters coming for us. It'll also shut down all radio communications for a few hours, which will severely screw up their response. (GRINS)
You see, Mr. Pritchett? There really is nothing for you to worry about. Pritchett's body seems to nod from the motion of the Humv
Hover and dance over the water in the early morning light
Hale has his shirt off and is wringing it out.
Goddamn it! He turns to see Terry trying to undo her buttons but unab her fingers are too numb.
Stupid buttons. I hate these shirts. They're ugly and stupid and -- Terry suddenly starts crying. It's not the shirt she's up about. Hale holds her.
It's okay.
We just ... I mean, we almost...
I know. 70.
A nuclear bomb went off.
That it did.
Are we...?
Look. (points at
If the butterflies are okay, then we'll be okay.
Really?

Absolutely. It says so in the manual. "If you see butterflies after a detonation, you are fine." Terry looks at Hale. She knows he's bullshitting her, but appreciates it. They look at each other. They could kiss but they both shy away from it. Terry gets her shirt off.
We better get moving. We might be able to reach Deakins when he gets to the river. They start off along a trail by the river.
Something I've been meaning to ask. (Terry looks at him) How did someone like you end up with a gun?
I hit a bankrobber with a frozen chicken.
Excuse me?

I came out here one summer during college. It was the campaign to stop the dam in the Grand Canyon. I loved it here. I came back, worked as a river guide and eventually stayed year-round. When a Park Ranger job came open, I applied. 71.
I'm still waiting for the chicken.

The local Parks Department wasn't sure how I'd do with the law enforcement part of the job. Well, one night I was coming home from the store and Tommy Drewson part of the local brain trust was robbing old Bob Kearney in front of the ATM. I bear old Bob yelling and I see Tommy heading for his car, so I tossed a bag of groceries at him at thirty miles an hour. A frozen chicken in the bag hit him in the forehead and he dropped like a rock. Next thing I know, I'm a Ranger. Hale looks at Terry with a new appreciation.
Deakins pilots the Humvee along the trail.
Hale and Terry are crouching behind a rock, looking down.
A zodiac raft has been pulled up on the river bank. A man an Uzi -- SHEPPARD -- waits, duffel bag by his feet.
Get me a frozen Zacky's fryer and he's a dead man. There's the sound of an approaching engine. Sheppard stan gun ready. The engine stops. A few seconds later...
Appears, walking down a footpath toward Sheppard.
Where is everyone?
I am everyone. Let's go. Sheppard hurries to Deakins. They disappear up the footpa 72.
Shit.
What?
We're the only ones who know what's going on, and I don't have the faintest idea how we're gonna stop them.
You'll think of something.
Why do you say that?
You have so far. Hale looks at Terry -- she's right. But it almost pisses off more than it gives him confidence. He grumbles to him and starts off down toward the raft.
Sink it?
Steal it. They get down to the raft. They climb in. Hale grabs the engine throttle, slumps.

Keys. Hale looks around, spots Sheppard's duffel bag lying on t riverbank. He hops out and starts rummaging through it wh they hear grunting and feet approaching. Hale looks around for a place to hide. There isn't any. T tries to get out of the raft, but she trips on a tarpauli bunched on the bottom of the raft. she drops.
Coming down a path, lugging the last remaining nuke.
Of the raft. Hale and Terry are nowhere to be seen. 73.
Is alone, in the water, on the far side of the raft, very silent. He hears Deakins and Sheppard load the nuke into raft.
Why were you driving around with a dead guy?

Because I like him. He doesn't ask a lot of annoying questions. All right? A few seconds later the engine starts up. Hale ducks down water as the raft takes off over him. He surfaces to watc raft zooming off into the distance. He is very worried.
The nuke is on a pallet in the middle of the raft. Sheppa pilots the raft. Deakins looks around, sees what he wants
Is lying on the deck of the raft along one side, all bunc It'd be the kind of thing you'd hide under.
Grabs the tarp and pulls.
There's no one there.
Throws the tarp over the nuke. As he does, we PAN OVER to
Strapped to one of the side pontoons. A small triangle of is sticking out from inside the crate -- like the corner shirt. It's quickly pulled out of sight from within.
Hale climbs out of the water and looks around, not knowin what to do.
The zodiac boat is on the shore. Sheppard and four man -- them the GUNMEN -- are hauling the nuke to the truck. Dea walks with another man -- MAX, 50s. Max checks his watch. 74.
Your friends in Washington should be getting the package about now.
I wish I could see their faces.
Baird, the Chairman, Creeley and the others are all stari slack-jawed at a TV screen.
Camcorder shot of Deakins against a black backdrop.

... two-hundred-and-fifty million dollars, by nine a.m. Utah time. The depositing instructions are in the envelope that came with this tape. This deadline is not negotiable, and there is no grace period. The device is on a timer. Shortly after you receive this, the timer will be activated. At nine a.m., I will make a call. If I find out you've done as you've been told, I will stop the timer. If you have not complied -- The screen suddenly cuts to a flurry of images of nuclear destruction -- buildings being knocked sideways, mushroom clouds, shockwaves, fires.
Turn that off!
Hale runs along the shoreline, headed for...
Where houseboats are rented out. Hale's eyes focus on a s with a picture of a phone on it.
The back gate of the truck is shut from the inside. The t starts up and rumbles off, slowly at first.
Jumps up from the raft and runs after the truck, staying behind. She grabs a handhold and pulls herself up. She ho on tight as the truck bounces off down the dirt road. 75.
Loud voices and crosstalk. Baird is on the phone, nodding
Yes, sir. Creeley's phone rings. He answers it.
Creeley.
(covers phone; to
The President wants to know if we know where the device is headed.
If Deakins had a plane waiting, it could be anywhere. We just don't know.
I do. (all eyes on him) Major Hale is alive. According to him, Colonel Deakins is headed for Salt Lake City.
Army helicopters are landing near the marina. Two are alr down. One has TROOPS standing outside of it.
Are walking toward the second helicopter.
We found the raft on the other side of the lake. Tracks from a heavy truck ran out when they hit the paved road.
If we get a rad scanner we can track them. A brief look between Wilkins and Giles.
Actually, Major, we're going back to McMurran.
What? 76.
We'd just like to ask you a few questions.
I'm not wasting time answering questions. We've got --

No debate, Major. I was given orders. Now, you can come with us, or you can go with them. Wilkins nods over at the other helicopter. The troops sta in front of it are MPs. Hale looks at Wilkins, astounded.
Wilkins is up front with the pilot. Hale and Giles are in All wear headsets. Hale is yelling at Wilkins.
Deakins thinks I'm dead. He thinks it's over. You've got to let me go after him. I can help. I know how his mind works.
Major, I know this is personal for you, but I think we can handle it. We're putting a wall of men and machines around Salt Lake City as we speak. That truck is not getting through.
Dusty slices of light come through the truck's slatted wa The nuclear weapon is lashed to a hammock, straps running D-rings on the sides. Max is hooking up an electronic tim
What about the Ranger?
What about her?
When you find that truck, you'll hit it hard. Chances are she'll be killed in the crossfire. "Regrettable but unavoidable." 77. Giles and Wilkins share a look -- Hale is right.
Look, she's not supposed to be there. She should be checking camping permits, finding lost kids. She... (BEAT)
She saved my life. Giles wants to help. So does Wilkins, but...

We were ordered to take you back to McMurran. You understand what orders are, don't you, Major? Wilkins turns away. Hale sits back, mind racing, not know what to do. He quickly grabs a pistol from the helicopter weapons rack and puts it to Wilkin's neck.
Major, put that away or say goodbye to your career and hello to twenty years in Leavenworth.
If that's what it takes.

You'll have to shoot me. Hale thinks, but there's no way he can do that. He lowers gun, sits back. Giles gets Hale's attention, then points to his own head. doesn't understand, so Giles grabs Hale's gunhand and put gun up to his head.
Colonel! How about this? Wilkins looks back, sees Hale holding the gun to Giles' h
(bad acting) I swear to God I'll shoot. Wilkins grins.
Max finishes hooking up the timer. He looks at Deakins.
Ready when you are. 78.
Wait until I get back. I'm going to check on Sheppard. Deakins goes to a ladder that leads up to the ceiling.
Hale is looking back and forth between what he sees out t window and the map on his lap.
I don't know what you're looking for, Major. Every road between here and salt Lake has already been sealed.
Deak would know that. Maybe he's not on the road. Wilkins doesn't understand.
They were using maps like these to set up the roadblocks?
Yes...?
Then that's the answer. Wilkins doesn't understand. Hale points outside, down at.
On the ground. Old ones, half-covered by weeds.
It's an old spur. Probably hasn't been used in twenty years. Nobody bothered to put it on the new maps.
What are you --?
The nuke isn't in a truck, Colonel. It's on a train.
A freight train -- engine, a car carrier (carrying a load Toyotas), several boxcars and a caboose. A hatch opens up the roof of one of the boxcars near the tail of the train 79.
Climbs out and we discover that indeed they are not in a they're in a train. The "nuke boxcar" has a small satelli dish mounted on the roof.
Are in position at points along the train, ready with Uzi
Wilkins hangs up the radio mike.
Radio's still down. We'll head north, look for a phone, then look for a train. Giles nods. Hale is thinking. Wilkins starts to tell the
No. Go south.
Salt Lake is north.
He's not going to Salt Lake.
But you said it would be Salt Lake. You found that hospital tag.
He planted that. He wanted whoever found it to think that's where he was going. (Shakes head) He's been doing a rope-a-dope. Giles and Wilkins look at him like he's nuts.
It's a boxing term. When Ali -- Look, I know this guy. If everything has been saying he's heading north, then he's heading south. They look at him, then Wilkins grabs the map.
What's south of here? 80.
Wilkins' finger follows the train line on the map. It goe right into Las Vegas.
No. Not Vegas. What the hell is there to blow up in Vegas? Wilkins' finger keeps moving on the map.
The President. Wilkins' finger stops.
Deakins jumps the gap between two boxcars and walks on. W ANGLE DOWN to reveal...
Crouching down between the two cars.
Sheppard is working with a torch, welding the brake and accelerator controls. Deakins enters. Sheppard turns the down. Deakins lights a cigarette off it.
How much longer?
Almost done.
Behind the driver's compartment is the engine itself, wit walkways along either side.
Creeps-up to one of the doors that lead into the driver's compartment. She hears...
How long until the helicopter gets here?
Five minutes. We'll leave from the boxcar roof. 81. Deakins turns to go.
Deakins opens the door and strides along beside the engin
Is hiding on the other side of the engine, very quiet and As Deakins goes out the back door of the engine, Terry fo
Terry comes out the door and is about to step across to t ladder on the boxcar when we PULL BACK to reveal...
As he puts a gun to the back of Terry's head.
A RANCHER comes out of the mini-mart with a cup of coffee heads for his old pickup truck. He starts to open his doo he hears, incongruously, whump-whump-whump. He looks up a
Comes in, gets about three feet off the ground and Giles out. As Giles runs to a payphone, the helicopter pulls up flies away, leaving the Rancher agog.
Terry comes down the ladder from the hatch, followed by D with a gun.
Terry, Max. Max, Terry.
(to Terry) A pleasure. (to Deakins) What the hell is a "Terry" and why is it still live?

She asked me how I thought I was going to get away with this and I thought I'd tell her. (to Terry) We're going to a cabin in the mountains, not far from here. When we get there I'm gonna make two phone calls. (MORE)
DEAKINS (cont'd) The first is to the Pentagon. I'm gonna tell them where the train is. (GRINS)

See, all their forces are up at Salt Lake by now. By the time they could get a F-15 down here the train will be on the outskirts of Vegas. And I'll remind them about the impact trigger -- if they hit this train hard, the nuke'll blow. (shakes head) They won't have any choice. They'll have to let the train get into the city and because of that, they'll have to pay.
You said two phone calls.
The second will be to my bank in Geneva. If the money's in my account, I use this... (pulls out what looks like a modified cell-
... and shut down the timer. If not, we sit back, put on some shades and get a quick tan.
But -- radio isn't working.
You saw the dish on the roof? Microwave. It's not affected by EMP. See? I really have thought of everything.
You kept her alive just so you can impress her with how smart you are?

(to Max) No, I kept her alive because I want her to do me a favor. See, if something goes wrong and this thing goes off, a half a million people are going to be vaporized. I don't want that on my conscience. So I'm not going to arm the nuke. (MORE)
DEAKINS (cont'd) (puts gun to Terry's
She is.
The room is silent. Everyone is looking at video monitors showing a map of Las Vegas. They are listening to a nervo ASSISTANT as he uses a telestrator to diagram the blast e

Starting at ground zero and moving out, we have, in terms of immediate effect, one hundred percent fatalities to thirty miles. Ninety percent from thirty to forty miles, dropping roughly ten percent for every-ten miles after that. The long term --
(cut to the chase) Son?
(looks up, seared) Two hundred and fifty thousand in the first few seconds. The same again within a year.
(it sinks in) Good God.
Terry is shaking, tears in her eyes, as she slowly-enters numbers Deakins tells her to in the nuke timer keypad.
Nine ... Then pound ... Good. Now six ...
Filled with tears. She blinks and...
Terry has visions of RETIREES in Vegas, watering potted p outside their motor home, of TEENAGERS ragging on each ot they walk to school, of CHILDREN in a playground.
Seven ... Star ... One... 84. And Terry shakingly pushing each button and then... The images of the retirees, the teenagers and the childre bleach out to white, fast, as if hit by a nuclear blast.
Then ENTER and it's done.
Her finger hovers over the ENTER button, almost pushes it shifts to CANCEL and pushes that.
The display goes blank.
Stunned. He shakes his head.
Ooh. You really shouldn't have done that. I said I would kill you, and I will.
I'm gonna be dead either way. I don't want any part of this. Deakins shrugs -- he sees her logic. He puts his gun to T head. Terry shuts her eyes.
Night-night. Deakins is about to pull the trigger when Max stops him. gestures -- listen. They hear a helicopter approaching. M checks his watch.
They're early. Just then, they hear gunfire. Max gives Deakins a look.
It's not a problem. Set the timer, then kill her. Have fun with it. Deakins starts climbing up the ladder to the hatch.
The GUNMAN at the caboose is firing on Wilkins's helicopt hanging a hundred yards off the back of the train. 85.
Max holds a pistol on Terry with one hand while he quickl the timer with the other.
Rests on Max's tool tray. Her fingers creep over to a vre
Presses ENTER and finishes setting the timer.
There.

Terry swings hard and fast with the wrench, knocking the of Max's hand. Max spins, and when Terry swings at him ag Max kicks the wrench out of her hand, then steps up fast hits Terry under the chin with the heel of his hand. She straight back.
Thought I was just friendly old Max, huh? Lady, I was a Navy SEAL. You should see what I can do with just my thumb. Max goes for his gun.
Grabs onto something. It's the wrench.
As Max turns back with the gun, Terry heaves the wrench. hits Max square in the forehead. He drops like a rock.
Yeah? Well, you should see what I can do with just a chicken.
Deakins joins his man on top of the caboose, firing on Wi helicopter.
Wilkins and Hale are returning fire. Hale points at Deaki
That's him! 86.
(to pilot) Get him!
They've got guns!
You've got a helicopter. Use it!
Deakins and the gunman keep firing on the helicopter as..
Comes swooping in.
Sees what's going to happen and turns and runs as...
Drops down beside the train. The rotor blades whip about feet over the train roof and the pilot starts forward.
Run from the blades as fast as they can.
Closes fast.
Jump from car to car. The gunman passes Deakins. Just whe helicopter blades are about to catch up to Deakins...
Jumps down between two boxcars and the rotor blades go ri over his head. Deakins hears an awful sound and a scream short.
Swooping fast over the train when suddenly...
Pops up out of the hatch, her back to the helicopter.
Pull up! 87.
Pulls up fast.
Watches the helicopter bank away. Bullets-start whizzing
Has climbed up and is shooting at her.
Runs away from Deakins, shooting Max's pistol behind her
Appear two cars ahead of Terry and start toward her, shoo
Is caught between Deakins and the gunmen with no way out
Comes along the length of the train, flying low. It rises and there's...
Hanging from the helicopter on a cable hooked to a harnes he's firing a pistol, shooting right over Terry at...
He's hit, falls off the train.
Aims at Terry and starts firing.
The bullets rip up the boxcar roof around her. She jumps grabs onto...
As he swings in on the cable, shooting his pistol.
Are lifted up and over... 88.
Who turns, firing a shotgun. Hale's bullets find him. He
Appears, firing an Uzi at Hale, Terry and the helicopter.
Bullets rip through. Wilkins is hit, knocked back.

head_text.subj: THE CABLE HOLDING HALE AND TERRY

text: Is severed by one of Sheppard's bullets.
Drop ten feet to the roof of a boxcar. Hale shoots as the
Is hit and drops.
Banks away fast, making ugly sounds, smoke billowing out. engine cuts out and the helicopter drops to a hard landin beside the tracks.
Watch the helicopter land as the train rolls on. They loo each other.
You stop the nuke. I'll stop the train. Hale nods. Terry starts forward, then turns.
I'd yell at you for coming after me, but you did just save my life. Hale grins. They hear a helicopter in the distance. They over to see...
Coming in fast.
Any excitement turns to confusion when they see... 89.
Standing in the doorway of the Red Cross helicopter, hold gun.
That's Deakins' escape route.
Not any more. Terry nods. They share a last look, then Terry heads off. coils up the winch cable, slings it over his shoulder and for the nuke boxcar and his old friend Deakins. He picks
Left by deceased Gunman #2.
Makes her way past the Toyotas.
Wilkins and the pilot stand outside their disabled helico The train is way off in the distance. They hear honking a turn to see...
Tearing toward then along a dirt road, horn honking.
The RANCHER from the mini-mart is driving; Giles beside h
Terry comes into the driver's compartment. She tugs at th brake and accelerator levers. It's useless. She looks aro spots a cigarette lighter.

Deakins and the one remaining GUNMAN hear the helicopter. start toward the ladder to the roof hatch when they hear footsteps on the roof of the car. Deakins gestures to the gunman.
