He raises his gun, trying to figure out where to Then they hear someone tugging at the hatch handle. The g opens fire on the hatch.

Bullets stream up through the hatch cover, but Hale is no in sight. One end of Hale's helicopter winch cable is tie the hatch cover. 90. We follow the cable fast, over to the side of the boxcar find...
Standing, tugging on the cable, still attached to the har Hale racks a load in the shotgun and jumps back off the s the train.
The gunman hears a sound, starts to turn, just as...
Swings into the boxcar on the cable, firing the shotgun.
Is picked up by the blast and smashed back through the wo wall of the boxcar and out of the train.
Climbs up fast through the hatch to the roof.
Shoots at Deakins, misses. The shotgun clicks empty. Hale tosses the gun then unhooks the cable from the harness. H drops to the floor-of the boxcar and runs to the ladder.
Terry has a three-foot length of gasoline-soaked cloth st into the gas tank opening of a Toyota on the lower level car carrier. She lights it and hurries off.
Deakins steadies himself as...
Hovers in sideways toward the train. The MAN in the doorw holds out a hand to Deakins.
Is reaching for the man's hand and grabs it when...
Reaches out of the hatch and grabs onto Deakins' foot. 91.
Deakins kicks free of Hale, holds onto the man in the hel and is pulled onboard.
Moves sideways over the train.
Deakins turns, pulling his gun and shoots down at the tra
Moves back sideways over the train.
No sign of Hale on the train roof.
Get us out of here!
Nods and starts to lift and bank. Then he gets an odd expression. The helicopter isn't doing what he wants.
Is hovering over the train, but it can't fly away because
Is hanging onto the skids and he's hooked the cable to th The other end of the cable is still attached to the hatch
Strains against the cable, but it doesn't snap.
Hurry!
Cross the track, a quarter-mile ahead.
Leans out of the helicopter with his Uzi, shooting down a 92.
Who grabs onto the cable and slides down it to the roof o train, bullets plugging in all around his. He jumps down through the hatch as...
Sees what's coming and jumps.
Hits...
Which snap, shoot sparks and wrap around the helicopter's
Breaks up and flies apart as the train rolls on.
The flame burning up the gas-soaked cloth goes into the T gas tank and...
Explodes.
Hale gets to his feet, goes to look at the nuke.
Five minutes and counting.
Looks at it, trying to figure out how to disarm it. He he the whoosh-thump of someone jumping down into the boxcar. turns.
Stands there, trying to smile, trying to be cool, but...
They would've paid and I would've stopped it. You've made a very, very big mistake.
It's over, Deak. I beat you. Disarm it. 93.
If it's over and you beat me, you disarm it.
Deak...
Course you are going to need this. (holds cell-phone
All you have to do is get it. (puts remote in
And if you do, as a special added bonus, you get this. Deakins pulls out...
Then pockets it.
Share a look. Deakins puts up his fists.
Ready? Hale puts up his fists.
It's a chain reaction, with one flaming Toyota setting of one above it or next to it.
Terry is looking under the car carrier.
The train car axle is smoking, grinding, glowing red in t from the flaming Toyotas.
Hale and Deakins circle each other.

Modern boxing is a pussy sport. They want to make it about scoring points. It's not about scoring points! It's about this! 94. Deakins fakes a right, jabs with his left, catching Hale chin. Hale is jarred. Blood runs from his mouth.

Okay. You're bleeding. Good. In the old fights, there'd be so much blood, guys would slip and fall. Let's see if we can't get a little more of that red goo out of you. Ready? Again Deakins fakes right, jabs left. Hale half blocks it is sent back.
The axle is bending, grinding, groaning.
Is between the car carrier and a boxcar, looking down at axle, not knowing what the hell she's going to do when sh a horn honking. She turns.

Used to be, every fight was to a knockout. You know what happens when you get knocked out? It's your brain slapping against the inside of your skull. Here. I'll let you see what it's like. Ready? Deakins steps toward Hale, about to finish him off. Deaki swings. Hale ducks, comes up hard with all he's got, gets Deakins under the chin and Deakins sails up and back, lan prone, seeing stars.
Stands over Deakins, in silhouette, the light of the hatc him. And then...
Snaps and...
Jumps the tracks.
Hale is thrown off his feet. 95.
Swings wildly in the hammock webbing.
Securing the webbing to the walls of the car start to sna
The front cars accordion sideways off the tracks, down a steep, embankment. It's all grinding, twisting, groaning
Fly, tumble, explode.
Hale tries to get to his feet, but then the floor starts dropping below him as...
Goes down the steep slope of the embankment and stops.
The sounds of the crash cease. Dust and smoke. Burning To
Flickering light from a burning Toyota comes in through t slatted walls. In this weird light, Hale sees...
It's above him, at the end (top) of the car. It's hanging mid-air, tangled up in the webbing. Two straps are the on things keeping the nuclear weapon from dropping twenty fe the bottom of the car.
Is lying at the bottom (end) of the car, directly under t nuke, not moving.
Looks around for something. He sees it --
On the floor. 96.
Flicker open. He sees...
Lying a few feet away.
You have to push amber, then red. You might have time to push amber. You won't get to red. Hale turns to see...
Pointing a gun at him.
The nuke is armed, Deak. If it falls, the impact trigger will set it off.
I know.
Half a million people will die.
(thinks, shrugs) Fuck 'em if they can't take a joke.
Holding the nuke tears through. One strap left.
His finger hovers over the amber button.
Do it and I shoot. Hale looks at Deakins.
I guess you really don't know me that well after all. Hale presses the amber button. 97.
Shoots.
Spins back, blood spraying from his shoulder.
Falls from his hand.
Is about to shoot again, then hears a tearing and looks u
Rips through and...
Drops toward him, point first.
Grabs the remote and his finger presses the RED button.
Mid-air, dropping, the clock and display go blank as...
His eyes fill with true terror as...
Punches into Deakins, point first, crushing him.
Gets to his feet and stands over Deakins. He reaches down opens Deakins' pocket and pulls out the twenty-dollar bil
Ready. He heads out of the boxcar.
Hale climbs out of the boxcar and starts running through train wreckage and burning cars, looking for Terry. 98.
Pulls up and a REPORTER and CAMERAMAN jump out.
Keeps running through the wreckage. He stops, unable to b when he sees...
In a boot, sticking out from under a burning Toyota.
Runs to the car, pulls at the foot, tries to push the car the body underneath. O.S. another vehicle drives up.
Come on! Oh, God. Oh, no. Hale is pulling hard on the foot when...
The Air Force pays you so little you have to steal shoes off dead people? Hale turns to see...
Walkins over from the Rancher's pickup truck.
Are behind her, grinning.
